title: Disgusting moment rowdy students from elite Melbourne school chant sexist song on a packed tram
text:
Students at an elite $19,000-a-year Melbourne school were filmed shouting a sexist chant on a packed tram.

A female passenger filmed the St Kevin's College students belting out the disturbing number called 'I wish all the ladies' on Saturday morning.

The footage was taken while the boys were on their way to an inter-school athletics carnival in south Melbourne.

The footage, obtained by ABC, shows the students - dressed in their school's stripped blue, green and yellow blazers - singing: 'I wish that all the ladies, were holes in the road'.

'And if I was a dump truck, I'd fill them with my load.'

The woman behind the camera, who called herself Melanie, said the 'disgusting' incident happened in front of young women, children and elderly passengers.

'You felt there was no respect for women,' she told ABC Radio Melbourne.

'You felt that you couldn't say anything and if you did, I think you'd be really concerned about what might happen next.'

Headmaster Stephen F. Russell apologised for the students 'offensive' actions in a statement to 3AW.

A female passenger filmed the St Kevin's College students chanting as they made their way to an inter-school athletics carnival in south Melbourne, on Saturday morning

'Students upset by the behaviour have already come to me and we have been following through in both a disciplinary and pastoral manner today,' he said.

'We have always and will continue to challenge such poor behaviour and misogynistic attitudes through programs at school and with the co-operation of parents.'

Founded in 1918, St Kevin's College Toorak is a leading Catholic boys school.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted the school for comment.
description: A female passenger filmed the St Kevin's College students belt out the disturbing chant in South Melbourne, as they made their way to an inter-school athletics carnival on Saturday morning.
authors: Zoe Zaczek For Daily Mail Australia
